business.headline: GST Council delays decision on insurance premiums to next meeting: ReportCurrently, policyholders are paying 18% GST on their premiums, and many hoped this rate would be reduced to ease the financial pressure.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, subscriptionBajaj Housing Finance IPO fully subscribed: The proceeds from this public offering will be used to strengthen Bajaj Housing Finance's capital base, positioning it to meet future business needs.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks surge, Godfrey Phillips down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 375.61 points to close at 81,559.54, while the Nifty50 gained 84.25 points to end at 24,936.40.
Government to monitor airline prices amid holiday travel surgeThe festive season typically sees a spike in travel demand, which often leads to increased ticket prices.

Caught in a whirlwind: Sebi's Madhabi Puri Buch faces mounting scrutinyUnder increasing pressure from external allegations and internal unrest, Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch faces a turbulent period marked by accusations of conflict of interest and claims of a toxic work culture. The path ahead remains uncertain.

18% GST on transactions under Rs 2,000 awaits fitment committee's call: ReportThe GST council did not make a final decision and chose to refer the issue to the fitment committee for further analysis and recommendations.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Should you subscribe or skip?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: The company aims to raise up to Rs 7,000 crore through the IPO, which includes both fresh equity and an offer-for-sale component.
Volkswagen proposes first-ever factory closure in Germany. Why it's a big deal?Volkswagen's management has revealed that the company's core brand needs to save 10 billion euros by 2026.
IndiGo plans to double international routes to 40 by year-end: ReportThe plan is part of a broader strategy to establish IndiGo as a leading global airline by 2030.

GST Council Meeting: Major relief likely for insurance buyers? The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, which is meeting on September 9, 2024, in New Delhi, is expected to discuss the possibility of removing the 18% GST on term life insurance premiums.
Adani Group warns Bangladesh over $500 million in unpaid power duesDespite recent growth, Bangladesh continues to face chronic energy shortages, worsened by dwindling domestic gas reserves.

Gala Precision Engineering makes solid market debut. Hold or sell? Gala Precision Engineering IPO listing: The shares of the company made a strong debut, listing at a 42% premium over the issue price on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: 10 points you need to knowThe proceeds from this public offering will be used to strengthen Bajaj Housing Finance's capital base, positioning it to meet future business needs.

GST Council Meet today: Insurance tax, payment aggregators — what to expectGST Council Meeting: The session is expected to address several critical topics, including the taxation of insurance premiums, proposed rate rationalisations, and more.

Should you apply for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO? Check GMP, expected gainsBajaj Housing Finance IPO: Investors are anticipating strong listing gains, as indicated by the company's grey market premium (GMP).

Sensex, Nifty open lower as weak US jobs data reignites recession fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 181.90 points at 81,002 at 9:19 am, while the NSE NIfty50 declined 49.55 points to trade at 24,802.60.

Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

'Multiple call recordings exist': Byju's cries foul after auditor BDO resignsIn a strong response to BDO's resignation, Byju's has accused the audit firm of making unethical requests and manipulating the audit process, including suggesting the backdating of financial reports.

Byju's crisis worsens as second auditor BDO resigns over financial concernsBDO's exit comes just a year after Deloitte, the company's previous auditor, stepped down citing problems with Byju's financial reporting.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Talks between AAP, Congress for Haryana alliance fail over seat-sharing: SourcesAccording to sources, the AAP wanted to contest on at least 10 seats, but the Congress wasn't willing to spare more than three for the Arvind Kejriwal-led party.

Kolkata horror: Supreme Court flags 'missing' paper, warns doctors to resume work A Supreme Court bench headed by Chief Justice DY Chandrachud asked the CBI to file a fresh status report in the Kolkata rape-murder case by next Tuesday.

Vinesh should have focused on achieving her Olympic goal: Uncle Mahavir PhogatWrestler Vinesh Phogat's uncle Mahavir Phogat objected to his niece joining politics and contesting elections in Haryana and said he wanted her to focus on winning a gold medal in the 2028 Olympics.

Caught in a whirlwind: Sebi's Madhabi Puri Buch faces mounting scrutinyUnder increasing pressure from external allegations and internal unrest, Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch faces a turbulent period marked by accusations of conflict of interest and claims of a toxic work culture. The path ahead remains uncertain.

Fresh iPhone 16 Pro price details leak hours ahead of Apple event tonightAccording to Mark Gurman, Apple could maintain the starting price of the iPhone 16 Pro at $999, quashing earlier rumours of a price hike for the entry-level Pro model.

Mamata Banerjee denies offering money to doctor's family, calls it slanderWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee asserted that no money was offered to the doctor's parents by Kolkata Police, dismissing the allegations as slander against her government.

Bangladesh targets Indian plate and palette, bans Padma hilsa for Durga PujaBangladesh had sent a 4,000-tonne consignment of Padma hilsa, considered to be tastier than the Indian varieties, before Durga Puja last year. Post-Hasina, Bangladesh has banned hilsa export in the months leading to Durga Puja in an assault on Indian plates and palettes. But hilsa-loving Indians seem to have found a way to skirt the ban.

Traitor can't understand RSS: Union Minister on Rahul Gandhi's remarks in US Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised Rahul Gandhi, stating that a "traitor" cannot understand the RSS, in response to the Congress MP's recent remarks about the ideological differences between the Congress party and the RSS.

Varanasi-bound Vande Bharat faces technical glitch, towed by train engineThe Vande Bharat Express train, which had departed from New Delhi and was on its way to Varanasi, encountered a technical glitch around 9.15 am.

How sure-footed India is best-placed to end Russia-Ukraine warIndia's diplomatic efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine war have gathered pace. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is travelling to Russia and Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be in the US after that. India is in a unique position to broker peace, having walked an independent line in a bipolar world, and done business with both camps.

Actor Vikas Sethi's wife on his final hours: He didn't want to be hospitalisedActor Vikas Sethi, known for his performances in many popular TV shows, died on Saturday night in his sleep. His wife, Jhanvi Sethi, now revealed what happened during the last hours before his death.
Chinese man, 30, dies after working for 104 days straight with 1 day offA Chinese man died from organ failure after working for 104 consecutive days with only one day off.

Anubhav Sinha was upset that I auditioned for IC 814: 'Chief' Rajiv ThakurRajiv Thakur, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.In, shared that director Anubhav Sinha was initially upset with casting director Mukesh Chhabra over his audition. Read on to know why.

Donald Trump, Kamala Harris neck and neck ahead of televised presidential debateThe latest polling confirms that Trump retains locked-in support from about half of voters, despite the Republican's historic status as a convicted felon and his role in instigating the unprecedented attempt to overturn his 2020 loss to Joe Biden.

China's only empress rose from harem to throne, used Buddhism to capture powerWu Zetian was a fifth-grade concubine in the Chinese royal harem in the 7th century who rose to become China's only empress. William Dalrymple's new book, The Golden Road: How Ancient India Transformed the World, sheds light on how she used Buddhism and Nalanda-trained scholars to capture and consolidate power.
Hyundai Alcazar 2024 launched at Rs 14.99 lakhHyundai Alcazar 2024 sits between the Hyundai Creta 2024 and the Hyundai Tucson in the carmaker's SUV line-up.

How the Bank of Bengal issued India's first paper currency in 1812On September 9, 1812, the Bank of Bengal issued India's first paper currency, revolutionising the financial landscape and paving the way for modern banking practices in the subcontinent.

35 dead as Asia's 'most powerful' Typhoon Yagi triggers landslides in VietnamThe typhoon was Asia's most powerful storm this year and made landfall on the country's northeastern coast on Saturday. It has disrupted power supplies and telecommunications in several parts of the country, mostly in Quang Ninh and Haiphong.
Video: Schoolgirl lifts auto-rickshaw, saves mother trapped underneathThe mother was struck by the auto-rickshaw while crossing the road to pick up her daughter from a tuition center.

ED accuses Religare's chief of criminal conspiracy; clean chit to Dabur's BurmansThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) cleared the Dabur Group promoters of allegations in a 2023 case and implicated Religare Chairperson Dr Rashmi Saluja and senior officials in a conspiracy to falsely accuse the Dabur promoters.

Tamil actor Jayam Ravi and wife Aarti announce separationTamil actor Jayam Ravi and his wife Aarti announced their separation on September 9. They were married for 15 years and are parents to two sons.

GST Council delays decision on insurance premiums to next meeting: ReportCurrently, policyholders are paying 18% GST on their premiums, and many hoped this rate would be reduced to ease the financial pressure.

Anand Mahindra posts life lesson inspired by Polish Paralympian's stunning high-jumpAnand Mahindra posted an inspiring video of Poland's Lukasz Mamczarz's incredible high jump at the Paris Paralympics 2024.

CBI seizes Rs 2.3 crore cash from Delhi pollution board official's homeThe CBI has arrested Mohammad Arif, a Senior Environmental Engineer with the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC), and Kishlaya Sharan Singh, the son of a middleman, for exchanging a bribe of Rs 91,500.

Manasilaayo: Rajinikanth's energy steals the show in Vettaiyan's 1st singleThe first track, Manasilaayo, from Rajinikanth's Vettaiyan has been released. Composed by Anirudh Ravichander, the track features the AI voice of late singer Malaysia Vasudevan.

Video: Jr NTR shoots for The Great Indian Kapil ShowJr NTR, who is awaiting the release of his film 'Devara', recently shot for an episode of The Great Indian Kapil Show. It will stream on Netflix. Along with Jr NTR, Janhvi Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan were also seen on the show's sets.

Exclusive: Actor Nithya Menen reveals her surname is made upActor Nithya Menen told IndiaToday.in that her surname, 'Menen', is made up. She shed light on her real identity and the reasons behind the change.

Vikrant Massey: People warned me against Sector 36, said I am a commercial actor nowVikramt Massey, while interacting with the media at a recent event, shared that many had advised him against 'Sector 36'. The film will stream on Netflix from September 13.

sports.headline: Oval Test: Pathum Nissanka Bazballs Sri Lanka to first win in England in 10 yearsPathum Nissanka was the star of the show as Sri Lanka denied England from completing a clean sweep of the series at the Oval on September 9, Monday.

Wet outfield in Greater Noida washes out opening day of AFG vs NZ one-off TestAfghanistan vs New Zealand, one-off Test: No play was possible on the opening day of the Test match due to wet outfield at the Shaheed Vijay Singh Pathak Stadium in Greater Noida on Monday, September 9.

Pro Kabaddi League season 11: Telugu Titans vs Bengaluru Bulls to start campaignThe full schedule of the Pro Kabaddi League season 11 has been released on September 9, Monday with Telugu Titans and Bengaluru Bulls starting the campaign on October 18.

I consider myself tailender: Iftikhar Ahmed explains his role in Pakistan team Pakistan's white-ball specialist, Iftikhar Ahmed, at times "felt like a tailender" when the team management asked him to bat as low as number 7 and 8 in limited-over games for the national team in the recent past.

Real Madrid's Rodrygo 'upset' over Ballon d'Or top 30 snub: Think I deserved itReal Madrid forward Rodrygo admitted that he was upset over his snub from the Ballon d'Or top 30 list and felt he deserved to be there. Rodrygo was a key part of the Real Madrid team that won the LaLiga and the UEFA Champions League.

Rishabh Pant on course to become all-time great in Test cricket: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly believes Rishabh Pant is on track to becoming one of the all-time greats in Test cricket. However, he emphasises the need for Pant to enhance his performance in white-ball formats.

Back to his audacious and chirpy best, Rishabh Pant returns to Test cricket foldIndia vs Bangladesh: Rishabh Pant was at his best with both bat and gloves in the first round of the Duleep Trophy in Bengaluru. Chirpy behind the stumps, the wicketkeeper-batter looked confident on his return to red-ball cricket. As expected, Pant was named in India's squad for the upcoming two-Test series against Bangladesh.

Don't sack Pakistan captains: Coaches Gillespie, Kirsten tell PCBPakistan's white and red ball head coaches Gary Kirsten and Jason Gillespie have advised the country's cricket board against sacking Babar Azam and Shan Masood.

Asian Champions Trophy: India thrash Japan 5-1 to extend winning run India continued their dominant run in the Asian Champions Trophy, securing a commanding 5-1 victory over Japan. With two consecutive wins, the defending champions have firmly established themselves as the team to beat.

South Africa name fresh faces for ODIs, T20Is against Ireland and AfghanistanSouth Africa announced the squad for the upcoming white-ball series against Afghanistan and Ireland beginning from September 18.

Chirpy behind the stumps, the wicketkeeper-batter looked confident on his return to red-ball cricket. As expected, Pant was named in India's squad for the upcoming two-Test series against Bangladesh.

South Africa name fresh faces for ODIs, T20Is against Ireland and AfghanistanSouth Africa announced the squad for the upcoming white-ball series against Afghanistan and Ireland beginning from September 18.

Australia hopeful of reclaiming Border-Gavaskar Trophy in huge summer: Josh HazlewoodBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia's pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood said Pat Cummins-led side is keen on ending India's series-winning streak in Test cricket. Rohit Sharma-led India will tour Australia for a five-Test series from November to January.

Why Kerala Blasters snubbed chance to sign Italy's Mario BalotelliKerala Blasters surprised football fans by rejecting Mario Balotelli due to disciplinary concerns and financial impracticality. Despite his global fame, the club opted for a cautious approach in their summer transfer decisions.

Paralympians outscore Olympians 5:1 in medals tally; here's whyIndian para-athletes scripted history at the Paris Paralympics, winning 29 medals, 10 more than their previous best tally from Tokyo. When the Indian contingent suffered from the curse of near-misses in the Olympics, the para-athletes delivered consistently on the big stage.

Rishabh Pant recalls Suryakumar Yadav's catch: 'Felt like everything was gone'India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant recalled Suryakumar Yadav's iconic catch to dismiss David Miller in the final of the T20 World Cup 2024.

OTD: Sachin Tendulkar scores maiden ODI hundred vs AustraliaSachin Tendulkar scored his maiden ODI hundred on September 9, 1994 against Australia at R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Opening the innings, he played a magnificent knock of 110 (130).

Taylor Fritz reacts to 'tough' US Open Final loss, rues failed plansTaylor Fritz's US Open final loss to Jannik Sinner extended America's 21-year Grand Slam drought, but his strong performance, along with promising showings from other U.S. players, suggests the wait for a champion may soon end.

'Khaa Maa Kasam': Rishabh Pant's hilarious banter with Kuldeep in Duleep TrophyIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was involved in a hilarious banter with Kuldeep Yadav on Day 4 of the Duleep Trophy clash between India A and India B.

Watch: Emotional Jannik Sinner dedicates US Open triumph to ailing auntJannik Sinner's emotional US Open victory became even more meaningful as he dedicated his triumph to his ailing aunt, sharing his joy with her during her challenging health battle, making his win a deeply personal milestone.

OTD: Sachin Tendulkar scores maiden ODI hundred vs AustraliaSachin Tendulkar scored his maiden ODI hundred on September 9, 1994 against Australia at R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Opening the innings, he played a magnificent knock of 110 (130).

Watch: Emotional Jannik Sinner dedicates US Open triumph to ailing auntJannik Sinner's emotional US Open victory became even more meaningful as he dedicated his triumph to his ailing aunt, sharing his joy with her during her challenging health battle, making his win a deeply personal milestone.

Inspired by local hero Sheetal Devi, teen without arms and legs begins trainingA viral video shows a 13-year-old girl from Sheetal Devi's village training in archery under the same coach, despite having no legs and arms. Her determination reflects the inspiring journey of India's Paralympic bronze medalist.

ENG vs SL: Josh Hull's 'slingy' action reminds Stuart Broad of Mitchell JohnsonFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad has said that Josh Hull's action reminds him of Mitchell Johnson. Hull made his debut in the ongoing third Test against Sri Lanka at the Oval.

Jannik Sinner reacts to 'Big 3' absence from Grand Slams: Nice for new championsJannik Sinner's US Open triumph after beating Taylor Fritz solidifies a new era in tennis, marking the first year without a "Big Three" Grand Slam champion, as fresh faces like his and Carlos Alcaraz's redefine the sport's competitive landscape.

American dream crashes after Taylor Fritz, Jessica Pegula lose US Open 2024: Taylor Fritz and Jessica Pegula could not survive the heat in the final after losing to Jannik Sinner and Aryna Sabalenka at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
